member.summary: Create Webhook
member.remarks: What we do at Conekta translates into events. For example, an event of interest to us occurs at the time a payment is successfully processed. At that moment we will be interested in doing several things: Send an email to the buyer, generate an invoice, start the process of shipping the product, etc.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: Use for knowing which language to use (optional, default to es)

member.name: P:Conekta.net.Client.Configuration.ApiKeyPrefix
member.summary:
Gets or sets the prefix (e.g. Token) of the API key based on the authentication name.
Whatever you set here will be prepended to the value defined in AddApiKey.
An example invocation here might be:
ApiKeyPrefix["Authorization"] = "Bearer";
where ApiKey["Authorization"] would then be used to set the value of your bearer token.
OAuth2 workflows should set tokens via AccessToken.
member.value: The prefix of the API key.

member.param: It is a value that allows identifying if the email is corporate or not. (default to false).

An email address is a series of customizable characters followed by a universal Internet symbol, the at symbol (@), the name of a host server, and a web domain ending (.mx, .com, .org, . net, etc). (required).
It is a parameter that allows to identify in the response, the Conekta ID of a payment method (payment_id).
It is a parameter that allows to identify in the response, the Conekta ID of the shipping address (shipping_contact).
Contains details of the payment methods that the customer has active or has used in Conekta.
Contains the ID of a plan, which could together with name, email and phone create a client directly to a subscription.
Contains the detail of the shipping addresses that the client has active or has used in Conekta.

member.name: T:Conekta.net.Model.OrderRequest
member.summary: a order

member.name: M:Conekta.net.Model.OrderRequest.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: List of [charges](https://developers.conekta.com/v2.1.0/reference/orderscreatecharge) that are applied to the order.
Currency with which the payment will be made. It uses the 3-letter code of the [International Standard ISO 4217.](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) (required).
List of [discounts](https://developers.conekta.com/v2.1.0/reference/orderscreatediscountline) that are applied to the order. You must have at least one discount..
List of [products](https://developers.conekta.com/v2.1.0/reference/orderscreateproduct) that are sold in the order. You must have at least one product. (required).
Allows you to fill out the shipping information at checkout.
Indicates whether the order charges must be preauthorized (default to false).
Indicates the processing mode for the order, either ecommerce, recurrent or validation..
Indicates the redirection callback upon completion of the 3DS2 flow..
List of [shipping costs](https://developers.conekta.com/v2.1.0/reference/orderscreateshipping). If the online store offers digital products..
List of [taxes](https://developers.conekta.com/v2.1.0/reference/orderscreatetaxes) that are applied to the order..
Indicates the 3DS2 mode for the order, either smart or strict..

member.name: T:Conekta.net.Model.OrderUpdateRequest
member.summary: a order
Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Currency with which the payment will be made. It uses the 3-letter code of the [International Standard ISO 4217.](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217).
List of [discounts](https://developers.conekta.com/v2.1.0/reference/orderscreatediscountline) that are applied to the order. You must have at least one discount..
List of [products](https://developers.conekta.com/v2.1.0/reference/orderscreateproduct) that are sold in the order. You must have at least one product..
Indicates whether the order charges must be preauthorized (default to false).
List of [shipping costs](https://developers.conekta.com/v2.1.0/reference/orderscreateshipping). If the online store offers digital products..

member.summary: The Transaction object represents the actions or steps of an order. Statuses can be: unprocessed, pending, available, owen, paid_out, voided, capture, capture_reversal, liquidation, liquidation_reversal, payout, payout_reversal, refund, refund_reversal, chargeback, chargeback_reversal, rounding_adjustment, won_chargeback, transferred, and transferred.

member.name: T:Conekta.net.Model.UpdateCustomer
member.summary: update customer
Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: It is a parameter that allows to identify in the response, the Conekta ID of a payment method (payment_id).
An email address is a series of customizable characters followed by a universal Internet symbol, the at symbol (@), the name of a host server, and a web domain ending (.mx, .com, .org, . net, etc)..
Contains the ID of a plan, which could together with name, email and phone create a client directly to a subscription.
It is a parameter that allows to identify in the response, the Conekta ID of the shipping address (shipping_contact).
It is a value that allows identifying if the email is corporate or not. (default to false).
Contains details of the payment methods that the customer has active or has used in Conekta.
Contains the detail of the shipping addresses that the client has active or has used in Conekta.
